page.title: 18HISTORIC HOUSE.
page.content: Ochiltree Castle was built in 1540 by a man called Stirling. It was restored in 1980 and won an award.It is a good example of a fortified house. There have been only four families living in it during its existence.The present owner is Lady Rusby and her husband. The house has four floors with two rooms on each. Upstairs there is an old fireplace and also a hole in the wall called the Laird's Lug covered by a tapestry in the past. The Laird went up to this hole in the room next door and listened to what people had to say about him. The grounds of the castle are quite small and are surrounded by open country, now used for farming.
